com.nttdocomo.ui
Class ShortTimer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.ShortTimer
All Implemented Interfaces:
TimeKeeper
public final class ShortTimer
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimeKeeper

This is a short timer class and supports the one shot timer and interval timer.
The canvas object can be registered as a listener to obtain a timer event. When a timer event is generated, the low level event handler method of the canvas is called.


The time scope is in the frame units. When a frame changes, the timer automatically stops. After stopping once, the timer will not automatically restart even after the frame is returned to. Also, when the canvas related to the short timer is not displayed on the screen and the start method is called, the start method shall do nothing.
When a dialog is displayed on the canvas that has been registered as the object of a short timer, the canvas shall not be notified of the timer event.


The short timer secures the native resource at the creation of the object and shall not release it until the dispose method is called.
When the application is suspended, the short timer stops. In other words, this is the same condition as when the stop method is called.

See Also:
Timer

Method Detail

getShortTimer

public static ShortTimer getShortTimer(Canvas canvas,
                                       int id,
                                       int time,
                                       boolean repeat)
This obtains a short timer object.
An exception is generated when a short timer object is created by designating the identical identifier ID with the identical canvas object.

Parameters:
canvas - Designates the canvas object that notifies the timer event.
id - Designates the timer ID.
time - Designates the timer event interval in milliseconds.
repeat - Designates "true" when generating timer events repeatedly and "false" to generate only one timer event.
Returns:
The short timer object.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument canvas.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a negative value is designated for the argument time.
UIException - Generated when native resource could not be secured (NO_RESOURCES).
UIException - Generated when trying to generate a timer by designating the ID that is identical to the timer registered with the canvas (BUSY_RESOURCE).

start

public void start()
This starts the timer.

Specified by:
start in interface TimeKeeper
Throws:
UIException - Generated when trying to use the start method after calling the start method with the interval timer or when trying to use the start method before receiving a timer notification after calling the start method with a one shot timer (ILLEGAL_STATE) .
UIException - Generated when starting the timer fails because native resources could not be secured (NO_RESOURCES).

stop

public void stop()
This stops the timer. If this method is called when the timer is stopped, this method does not do anything.

Specified by:
stop in interface TimeKeeper

dispose

public void dispose()
This disposes of the timer. UIException is generated when a method other than dispose is called after calling this method (ILLEGAL_STATE). When the dispose method is called after calling this method, nothing generated.

Specified by:
dispose in interface TimeKeeper

getResolution

public int getResolution()
This obtains the timer resolution. Timer resolution is the shortest interval from the occurrence of a timer event to the next occurrence. This time interval varies from system to system.

Specified by:
getResolution in interface TimeKeeper
Returns:
The timer resolution in milliseconds.
